title: 'Schizophrenic nature': Dr. Birx describes what it was like working in Trump's White House
description: Former White House Coronavirus Response Task Force Coordinator Dr. Deborah Birx joins CNN's Jake Tapper to discuss her criticisms of former President Trump's Covid-19 strategies during the pandemic's early days.

title: Bad Bunny lands Marvel role as Spider-Man character El Muerto
description: Bad Bunny is set to join the Marvel universe.

title: Woman stranded in California woods for 6 days survived on yogurt and snow
description: A woman who was stranded for six days in the woods of Lassen County, in northeastern California, rationed a six-pack of yogurt and ate snow to survive before being rescued, a release from the Lassen County Sheriff's Office said.

title: Top US general tells CNN 'global international security order' is at stake following Russia's invasion of Ukraine
description: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley told CNN's Jim Sciutto on Tuesday that the entire "global international security order" put in place after World War II is at stake if Russia gets away "cost-free" following its invasion of Ukraine.

title: A major recession is coming, Deutsche Bank warns
description: Deutsche Bank raised eyebrows earlier this month by becoming the first major bank to forecast a US recession, albeit a "mild" one.

title: Kevin McCarthy was asked about his Trump lie. His answer was gibberish
description: On Monday, during a trip to the US-Mexico border, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy was asked why he had lied about the idea of asking then-President Donald Trump to resign in the wake of the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol.

title: Robin Roberts said she almost turned down a 2012 interview with Barack Obama over concern of being outed
description: Robin Roberts nearly turned down a 2012 interview with then-President Barack Obama about marriage equality because she was afraid she would be outed.

title: He was forcibly deported under Soviet rule. Here's what he thinks about the Ukraine war
description: Pictures have emerged of Mariupol residents arriving in Siberia by train. Ukraine says they were forcibly deported, prompting comparisons to an ugly chapter in the history of the Soviet Union, when millions of people were forcibly taken to remote parts of the Union to crack down on dissent. CNN's Scott McLean spoke with Enno Uibo about his own experience as a forced deportee from Estonia to Siberia.

title: Wimbledon organizers feared Russian participation would fuel a 'propaganda machine'
description: Banning Russian and Belarusian tennis players from this year's Wimbledon tournament in light of the war in Ukraine is not discriminatory, say organizers of the grand slam tournament.

title: Garland says funds from assets US seizes from Russian oligarchs should go 'directly to Ukraine'
description: Attorney General Merrick Garland said Tuesday that he supports efforts to allow some of the proceeds from assets the Justice Department seizes from Russian oligarchs to go "directly to Ukraine."

title: Video of Alec Baldwin's initial interview after deadly shooting on 'Rust' set released by investigators
description: Newly released video evidence from the investigation into a deadly shooting last year on the set of the film "Rust" shows investigators' first interview with actor Alec Baldwin shortly after the incident.

title: Senate report details 'ongoing mistreatment' of service members and their families living in privatized military housing
description: A new bipartisan investigation by a Senate panel alleges one of the nation's largest military housing companies put the health and safety of military families at risk even after the housing company, Balfour Beatty Communities, pleaded guilty in December 2021 to committing fraud against the United States from 2013 to 2019.

title: Could Bernie Sanders run again in 2024?
description: In today's episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza breaks down the likelihood of a Bernie Sanders 2024 presidential run.

title: George Conway reacts to Marjorie Taylor Greene's text
description: Conservative attorney George Conway reacts to texts from GOP leaders to former President Trump's White House chief of staff Mark Meadows on January 6.

title: Elon Musk wants to make Twitter a haven for free speech. That's raising alarms
Master sommelier Carlton McCoy shares his most memorable drinks
description: Carlton McCoy's favorite ritual is one as old as human memory: Share a meal and a drink to more intimately understand a person or a place. That exercise is the framework of the master sommelier's latest endeavor -- the CNN Original Series "Nomad" -- in which McCoy explores what he calls the "pillars of culture" through the lesser-seen sides of different destinations, including Seoul, Paris and his home city of Washington, DC.

title: Tiny male spiders catapult to safety to avoid being devoured by their mates
description: When one tiny species of spider mates, one partner needs a special move to survive the encounter.

title: Tigrayan forces say they are withdrawing from Ethiopia's Afar region
description: Tigrayan forces are fully withdrawing from Ethiopia's Afar region, a spokesperson for the Tigrayan People's Liberation Forces (TPLF) told CNN on Monday, saying the pullout should allow humanitarian aid to reach the area.

title: Palm oil is in half your groceries. Here's why prices might shoot up
description: Indonesia will start restricting exports of palm oil this week, a move that could make the global food crisis worse and push up the prices of hundreds of consumer products.

title: A powerful portrait of motherhood and exotic dancing
description: When Hajar Benjida began photographing exotic dancers around the Atlanta area, she didn't want to take typical images of them performing on stage. Instead, she photographed many of the women at home, including Cleo, who had recently given birth to a baby boy named Andy.

title: Biden will commute or pardon sentences of 78 non-violent people. Here are a few to know
description: President Joe Biden will mark "Second Chance Month" at the White House on Tuesday, commuting the sentences of 75 people serving time for nonviolent drug offenses, issuing full pardons for three individuals who the administration says have worked toward rehabilitation and unveiling new actions aimed at easing the transition back to normal life for the formally incarcerated.

title: Graffiti artist explains the process behind making epic murals
description: Join chef and master sommelier Carlton McCoy as he travels the world chasing what it means to be authentic. The new Original Series "Nomad with Carlton McCoy" premieres Sunday, May 1, at 10 p.m. ET

title: Second death reported in new Ebola outbreak in Democratic Republic of Congo
description: Health authorities in the Democratic Republic of Congo are scrambling to contain an Ebola outbreak after a second person died from the virus, the World Health Organization (WHO) said Tuesday.

title: Haberman: This is what struck me about Ivanka Trump's texts
description: CNN's Maggie Haberman and Errol Louis discuss what stood out to them from the thousands of text messages that former President Donald Trump's White House chief of staff Mark Meadows sent and received between Election Day 2020 and President Joe Biden's  inauguration.

title: Women responded better than men to early Alzheimer's intervention, study found
description: After age and genetics, being a woman is the single most important risk factor for developing Alzheimer's disease, experts say.

title: Germany agrees to send heavy weapons to Ukraine after major policy U-turn
description: Germany has agreed to deliver anti-aircraft tanks to Ukraine, the German Defense Ministry announced on Tuesday, a move that underscores a major shift in its approach to providing military help to Ukraine.

title: What I realized after catching Covid-19
Trump-endorsed candidate gets in tense exchange at first Senate primary debate
description: Trump-endorsed candidate and celebrity doctor Mehmet Oz went up against GOP rivals in the first primary debate for Pennsylvania's Senate seat.

title: The surprising reasons why Atlanta's airport is the world's busiest
description: Atlanta is "The Big City" to Deep South residents. But once you leave the region, it starts to feel smaller.

title: Reports of anti-Semitism in the US hit the highest number on record in 2021, Anti-Defamation League says
description: The number of reports of assaults, vandalism and harassment targeting Jewish communities and individuals in the United States was the highest on record in 2021, the Anti-Defamation League said Tuesday.

title: Viola Davis responds to criticism of her Michelle Obama portrayal
description: Viola Davis is aware that not everyone loves her portrayal of Michelle Obama in the Showtime series, "The First Lady."

title: 30 classic Italian dishes that everyone should try
description: Think of Italy and you're likely to think of food first, and all the other beautiful things it offers second.

title: FINA investigates Russian swimmer Evgeny Rylov competing in national championships despite being banned
description: The International Swimming Federation (FINA), swimming's global governing body, says it is investigating Russia's Evgeny Rylov after the swimmer took part in his country's national championships, despite receiving a nine-month ban just four days ago.

title: Seizing yachts was a good start. Here are some other places Russian oligarchs stash their cash
description: Two months into Moscow's brutal invasion of Ukraine, the United States continues to roll out unprecedented sanctions against a rogues' gallery of Russian oligarchs, including many of the country's most affluent and influential men.

title: Why no one dare tell Xi the awful truth
Green jet fuel is here -- so why are airlines not using it?
description: There is a small chance that your next flight will be powered, at least in part, by used cooking oils or agricultural waste.

title: The lies and delusions revealed in Mark Meadows' texts are already poisoning the next election
description: The most chilling takeaway of a new haul of texts showing how former President Donald Trump's inner circle schemed to steal the 2020 election is not the delusional fervor of their plan or the casual way plotters rejected the legitimate will of the American people.

title: Kim vows full speed ahead for North Korea's nuclear program as he flaunts ICBMs
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un vowed on Monday to ramp up his development of nuclear arms, as a military parade in Pyongyang showcased the country's most advanced weaponry yet -- including an intercontinental ballistic missile experts say puts the entire US mainland in range.

title: Meet three Black climbers taking representation to new heights on summits across Africa and around the world
description: Andrew Alexander King will never forget the first time he took on Tanzania's Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's tallest peak and the world's largest freestanding mountain, in 2018.

title: Poetic, raw and darkly comical. A Ukrainian author shares her war diary
description: In Mariupol, a woman drags her dead husband's body into the bullet-ravaged husk of their car. In Kyiv, the statues of ancient philosophers peer out from behind protective scaffolding. Elsewhere, parents write names and phone numbers on their children's backs, in case of the unthinkable.

title: Olympic champion Chloe Kim is taking a break for her mental health
description: Double Olympic snowboarding champion Chloe Kim said she will sit out the 2022-23 season to focus on her mental health after a "draining" year.

title: This is the video Chinese censors don't want you to see or share
description: Voices charged with raw frustration, agony and desperation are among the montage of audio recordings featured in "Voices of April," a video documenting the harsh impact of Shanghai's nearly month-long lockdown. CNN's David Culver reports.

title: Coffee, tea and nagging at Japan's anti-procrastination cafe
description: Writers facing deadlines go to Tokyo's "Manuscript Writing Cafe" with an understanding -- they can't leave until their work is done.

title: Watch TikTok star give away cash for acts of kindness
description: Social media star Jimmy Darts has given away over a hundred thousand dollars.  He looks for strangers to perform random acts of kindness and hands them money.

title: Amazon's proposed new building looks like this emoji
description: The shape of Amazon's screwy new headquarters inspires mock and awe. CNN's Jeanne Moos has the best jokes.

title: CNN crew gets caught in active Russian shelling
description: While shadowing paramedics in Kharkiv, Ukraine, CNN's Clarissa Ward and her team were forced to run for safety after getting caught in Russian shelling.
